security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference material for CC-DevFlow Constitution. Static scanner detected patterns in markdown code examples as security risks, but all findings are false positives. The skill has no executable code, network calls, or file system operations. All 58 static findings were evaluated and dismissed as documentation artifacts.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle to remember and apply development workflow rules consistently. This skill provides quick access to all 10 Constitutional Articles, Phase -1 Gates, and common scenario answers from the CC-DevFlow Constitution v2.0.0.
actual_capabilities: Summarize all 10 Constitutional Articles with key rules and examples
List Phase -1 Gates enforced by the planner agent before EPIC generation
Provide quick lookup answers for common development scenarios
Link to full Constitution document for detailed reading
limitations: Does not contain the complete Constitution text (see project-constitution.md for full details)
Does not provide implementation guidelines for specific agents
Does not execute any validation or enforcement actions
Does not modify or create any files

use_cases.title: Review Project Requirements Against Constitution
use_cases.description: Before generating EPICs, verify your project scope meets Phase -1 Gates (simplicity, anti-abstraction, integration-first testing requirements).

use_cases.title: Check Code Quality Rules During Development
use_cases.description: Quick lookup of Article I (Quality First) and Article II (Architectural Consistency) rules when writing or reviewing code.

use_cases.title: Resolve Common Development Questions
use_cases.description: Get instant answers to questions like 'Can I add TODO for later?' or 'Should I create BaseController?' based on constitutional rules.

faq.question: Does this skill enforce the Constitution rules?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides reference information. Enforcement happens through guardrails like constitution-guardian and devflow-tdd-enforcer, and Phase -1 Gates in the planner agent.

faq.question: Where is the full Constitution text?
faq.answer: The complete Constitution is in .claude/rules/project-constitution.md. This skill provides summaries and links only.

faq.question: How does this skill differ from the constitution-guardian?
faq.answer: This skill is a reference guide that provides information. The constitution-guardian is a guardrail that actively blocks code that violates constitutional rules.

faq.question: What are Phase -1 Gates?
faq.answer: Phase -1 Gates are checks performed by the planner agent BEFORE generating EPIC and TASKS. They enforce Articles VII (Simplicity), VIII (Anti-Abstraction), and IX (Integration-First Testing) early in the planning process.

faq.question: Can I use this skill to check if my code is compliant?
faq.answer: You can use this skill to understand what the rules are, but actual compliance checking is done by validation scripts like validate-constitution.sh and code review agents.

faq.question: What happens if I violate the Constitution?
faq.answer: Violations are blocked by real-time guardrails during development, caught by validation scripts during batch checks, or flagged during code review. Specific consequences depend on the article and enforcement mechanism.
